Veiled Lady.name: Veiled Lady
Veiled Lady.description:
Hyphan colonies have an entirely alien system of ethics compared to other races of The Low. They have no concept of ‘murder’ or ‘theft’; everything is simply ‘useful’ or ‘waste’. This simplified outlook on life often brings hyphan colonies into conflict with other races.

Some colonies employ a plan of rapid relocation, moving themselves to new locations as soon as their existence is discovered. Others act hyper-aggresively, consuming any creature the moment it steps within their borders. Some colonies, in particular those that are in close proximity to other races, have developed a humanoid-like persona to interact with those peoples: a veiled lady.

The landscape of hyphan foreign policy is constantly changing as strategies that result in extermination fail to propogate, and colonies develop new, unique schemes.

Appearance. In the dim light of an underground cavern, a veiled lady appears as a huge, gowned silhouette, faintly feminine in shape. Closer inspection reveals a hollow where one might expect a cranium, and skin formed of constantly shifting threads of ultra-fine mycelia. A veiled lady appears to drift across the floor, gliding up unclimbable walls and squeezing through minute gaps without apparent effort.

Hyphal Tether.description: Tendrils of grasping hyphae burst from the ground, grabbing at one creature the Veiled Lady can see within 30 feet of the it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or become &Reference[grappled] (escape DC [[lookup @abilities.dex.dc]]). Until this grapple ends, a creature is restrained

save.chatFlavor: On failure: grappled. While grappled in this way: restrained.

The Veiled Lady can take 3 legendary actions.

Legendary Resistance (3/day).description: If the Veiled Lady fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Amorphous.name: 无定形

Mycelia Climb.name: Mycelia Climb
Mycelia Climb.description: The Veiled Lady can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Symbiotic Vigour (Recharges after a Shor.name: Symbiotic Vigour (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
Symbiotic Vigour (Recharges after a Shor.description: Symbiotic Vigour (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). If the veiled is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn’t die or fall unconscious. Instead, beetles, hyphae, and grubs swarm over it, it recharges all its Infectious Spore and Shackles of Pain, regains [[lookup @attributes.hp.max]] hit points, gains [[lookup @attributes.hp.max]] temporary hitpoints, and becomes Large-sized as a thick mat of mycelial webbing grows to cover it.

Spore Bloom.name: Spore Bloom
Spore Bloom.description: Spore Bloom. The Veiled Lady recharges and uses its Infectious Spores or Shackles of Pain. The Veiled Lady must use a different legendary action before it uses this one again.

Whirlwhip (Costs 2 Actions).name: Whirlwhip (Costs 2 Actions)
Whirlwhip (Costs 2 Actions).description: The Veiled Lady flicks its whip in a wide circle. Each creature within 10 feet of the Veiled Lady must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage]] damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

The creature must succeed on a [[/save con dc=@abilities.con.dc format=long]] or become afflicted as per the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.cIWJunlaFvcCbpPQ]{Fungal Infection} spell for the next minute. Shackles of Pain (Recharge 5-6).description: The Veiled Lady exhales a cloud of spores at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save con dc=@abilities.con.dc format=long]] or become afflicted as per the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.oj0UVBJsE0I866Py]{Shackles of Pain} spell; each time the Veiled Lady takes damage, the afflicted creature takes psychic damage equal to half that damage and can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. Fungal Infection.name: Fungal Infection
Fungal Infection.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock, Wizard

With an exhalation, fungal spores waft their way towards a point within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centred on that point must succeed on a [[/save con format=long]] or become cursed until the spell ends.

When you cast the spell, choose one of the following fungi to grow on the cursed creatures:

  • Amanita Rotgut. The creature immediately takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage and becomes &reference[poisoned]. While poisoned in this way, the creature takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage at the end of each of its subsequent turns.
  • Necrotising Zygomycosis. The creature immediately takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage, and takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage at the start of each of its turns.
  • Psilocybin Quickitrippiae. The creature begins ‘tripping’. It must roll a [[/r d4]] at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature doesn’t move or take actions this turn.
  • Paralysing Mucorales. At the end of each of the creature’s turns, it becomes &reference[stunned] until the start of its next turn. If the creature fails a saving throw against this spell by 5 or more then, if it would be &reference[stunned], it is &reference[paralyzed] instead.
  • Raging Henbane. The creature becomes &reference[charmed] by you and must use its reaction at the start of each of its turns to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach/range other than you.
  • Veiled Lady. The creature’s vision darkens to a pinhole; the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks have advantage against the creature.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns (after the effects of this spell have triggered), ending the effect on itself on a success.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) of Amanita Rotgut and Necrotising Zygomycosis increases by [[/damage 1d6]] and [[/damage 1d8]], respectively, for each slot level above 4th. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can choose two different fungi to grow on affected targets instead of one.

Shackles of Pain.name: Shackles of Pain
Shackles of Pain.description:
Class: Bard, Cleric, Paladin, Warlock

You link the vitality of a willing creature within range—the source—to the psyche of another creature within range—the target. The target must succeed on a [[/save cha format=long]] or become linked to the source for 1 minute. Each time the source takes damage, the target takes psychic damage equal to half the damage the source took. If you yourself are the source, the creature takes this damage immediately before you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration. Whenever the target takes damage in this way, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

Target of Pain.name: Target of Pain

Mycelial Reconstitution.name: Mycelial Reconstitution
Mycelial Reconstitution.description: Mycelial Reconstitution.  The Veiled Lady dissolves into mycelia, ending any grapples or restraining effects to which it is currently subjected, and reappears in an unoccupied space on the ground it can see within 30 feet of it. This does not end grapples created by the Veiled Lady’s Hyphal Tether.

Whip.description: Whip. The Veiled Lady makes a halluciwhip attack.

Communication Spores.name: Communication Spores
Communication Spores.description: The Veiled Lady’s telepathy extends throughout its lair. It communicates using images and emotion.

Detritivore.name: Detritivore
Detritivore.description: As a bonus action, the Veiled Lady can target one Small or larger corpse not under the effects of the gentle repose spell or one Small or larger creature that has 0 hit points and is still alive that the Veiled Lady can see within 5 feet of it. If the target is alive, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or automatically fail one death saving throw. On a failure, or if the target is a corpse, the Veiled Lady regains [[/heal average]] hit points. Once a corpse has been targeted by this feature, it becomes desiccated and can’t be targeted again.

Infectious Spores.description: The heart chooses one creature within the lair. Sprout Puffballs.name: Sprout Puffballs
Sprout Puffballs.description:
Grey-black puffballs sprout in a 10-foot square originating from a point on a surface within the lair. Each 5-foot square area of puffballs has AC 5, 1 hit point, immunity to necrotic damage, and immunity to all conditions bar petrification. The puffballs automatically fail all saving throws.

The puffballs erupt if they take any damage or a creature moves into their space, immediately destroying a 5-foot square. Each creature within 5 feet of the puffballs when they erupt must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

Hyphan.name: Hyphan
Hyphan.description:
Foundry Note: Assign the hyphan's Challenge Rating (CR) to your Tamer level for the correct proficiency bonus.

Hyphan

A helpful fungal friend, the hyphan’s climbing ability makes it especially useful for dusting those hard-to-reach corners. It’s also very good at stopping bar fights; it has a real calming presence. I just have to remember to put him in the basement when we want to really let loose and break some furniture.

— Heliana, Tavern Brawler

Type: Plant

Creature Component: Hyphan

Bonus Tamer Improvement: @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.KzkDe7MEWx7oVWLE]{Helpful} and +2 Hit Dice

Always keen to offer aid, hyphans make excellent support companions, both on the battlefield and emotionally. Able to calm intense emotions, charm aggressors, and disappear into the earth, they are experts in de-escalation and can aid a party’s escape by lacing large areas with necrotising puffballs.

Calming Spores (1/Day).description: One creature within 30 feet of the hyphan must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or have its emotions calmed for the next minute. A willing creature can choose to fail this saving throw. The hyphan can choose to suppress any effect causing the target to be charmed or frightened. When this effect ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration hasn't expired in the meantime. Alternatively, the hyphan can make the target indifferent about creatures of its choice that the target is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the effect ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the GM rules otherwise.

Swarm Spawner Fungus.name: Swarm Spawner Fungus
Swarm Spawner Fungus.description:
Puffling Swarm Spawner

A rapid rustling sound and the gleam of hundreds of tiny proto-eyes might be the only warning an adventurer receives as it walks through a field of swarm spawner fungi. From the depths of these morel-like mushrooms are fired a swarm of six-inch-tall, walking toadstools, whose paper-like skin trembles with contained explosive potential.

Explosive Investment. Though the actions of a swarm spawner fungus and its self-destructive pufflings might seem spiteful at the outset, its actually a carefully measured trade off. If a colony can gain more biomass than it expends to acquire that biomass, then there is a net gain, and the colony can expand. Using the aeons-spanning knowledge and experience hive minds have at their disposal, hyphan colonies have learnt to hold off from unleashing their traps until its quarry has progressed so deep within a fungal field that its chances of escape are nil.

On a failure, the creature takes 13 ([[/r 2d12]]) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and pushes the brute back to the space from which it moved. While the brute occupies the space of a creature it knocked prone in this way, the creature is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, it is restrained.

Lithe, graceful, or otherwise agile creatures can expect to become duskcaps if they should find themselves overcome by a hyphan colony’s grasp. Primarily information gatherers, duskcaps are adept at passing without notice, and often patrol a colony’s periphery, acting as its eyes and ears.

Brainless Senses. An isolated duskcap—indeed any isolated hyphan—does not possess the ability to understand what it hears; it is the fungal hive mind that interprets those sounds. While a duskcap is within range of a colony’s communication spores, this interpretation happens instantaneously. However, if a duskcap should range beyond these spores, it will record everything it hears, to be transmitted to the hive mind with unfailing accuracy upon its return.

Legendary Actions.description:
The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them, with the brute choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The fungal guardians regain spent legendary actions at the start of the turn of the guardian with the highest initiative.

The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them.

Spike Storm (sphere).name: Spike Storm (sphere)
Spike Storm (sphere).description: The duskcap fires a torrent of spikes in either a 20-foot cone or in a 10-foot sphere. Each other creature in the area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) piercing damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success.

Cunning Action.name: 灵巧动作
Cunning Action.description: On each of its turns, the hyphan can use a bonus action to take the dash, disengage, or hide action.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The hyphan deals an extra 14 ([[/r 4d6]]) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the hyphan that isn't incapacitated and the hyphan doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

Spike (ranged).name: Spike (ranged)
Spike (ranged).description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 ([[/r 1d4 + 5]]) piercing damage.

Spike Storm (cone).name: Spike Storm (cone)
Spike Storm (cone).description: The duskcap fires a torrent of spikes in either a 20-foot cone or in a 10-foot sphere. Each other creature in the area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) piercing damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success.

F5osiDfHZHOvuxn1.name: Vigorous Hyphan Duskcap
F5osiDfHZHOvuxn1.description:
Lithe, graceful, or otherwise agile creatures can expect to become duskcaps if they should find themselves overcome by a hyphan colony’s grasp. Primarily information gatherers, duskcaps are adept at passing without notice, and often patrol a colony’s periphery, acting as its eyes and ears.

Brainless Senses. An isolated duskcap—indeed any isolated hyphan—does not possess the ability to understand what it hears; it is the fungal hive mind that interprets those sounds. While a duskcap is within range of a colony’s communication spores, this interpretation happens instantaneously. However, if a duskcap should range beyond these spores, it will record everything it hears, to be transmitted to the hive mind with unfailing accuracy upon its return.

Sun Sickness.name: 厌日症
Sun Sickness.description: While in sunlight, or if it takes 15 or more radiant damage in a single turn, the hyphan has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. The brute dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

Flanking Strike.name: Flanking Strike
Flanking Strike.description: The duskcap moves up to 20 feet and makes one attack with its spike.

Vigorous Hyphan Brute.name: Vigorous Hyphan Brute
Vigorous Hyphan Brute.description: Strong and burly creatures will be formed into brutes. Used for clearing rockfalls and to intimidate interlopers in a hyphan’s domain, these large specimens’ size can often act as an impediment in the tight tunnels of The Low. On the battlefield, brutes act as juggernauts, sending ranks of foes to the floor—perfect targets for their smaller cousins, the duskcaps. Their bulk and toughness allow them to fight without any sense of self preservation as they rampage through the enemy lines.

Grounded.name: Grounded
Grounded.description: The brute has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to prevent it being moved against its will.

Reckless.name: 鲁莽
Reckless.description: At the start of its turn, the brute can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

Smush.name: Smush
Smush.description: The brute moves up to 5 feet and can occupy the space of a creature 1 or more sizes smaller than it. A creature whose space it enters must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failure, the creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and is knocked &Reference[prone]. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and pushes the brute back to the space from which it moved. While the brute occupies the space of a creature it knocked prone in this way, the creature is &Reference[grappled] (escape DC [[lookup @abilities.str.dc]]). Until this grapple ends, it is &Reference[restrained].

Rampage.name: 横行
Rampage.description: The brute moves up to its speed and can move through the spaces of creature 1 or more sizes smaller than it. Each creature whose space it moves through must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage and being knocked prone on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked &Reference[prone] on a success. A creature can be affected by this action no more than once per turn.

Infectious Spores.name: Infectious Spores
Infectious Spores.description: Infectious Spores. The heart chooses one creature within the lair. A variety of small mushrooms grow around it, releasing their spores and casting the  spell @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.cIWJunlaFvcCbpPQ]{Fungal Infection} on it (no concentration required; DC 15 Constitution saving throw).

Mindfunk Spores.name: Mindfunk Spores
Mindfunk Spores.description: Mindfunk Spores. The heart chooses one creature within the lair, shooting a spray of spore-containing acid at it from a nearby toadstool. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 3d6]] acid damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM]{Dominate Person} spell until the end of its next turn. The heart can’t use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

Sprout Puffballs.name: Sprout Puffballs
Sprout Puffballs.description:
Sprout Puffballs. Grey-black puffballs sprout in a 10-foot square originating from a point on a surface within the lair. Each 5-foot square area of puffballs has AC 5, 1 hit point, immunity to necrotic damage, and immunity to all conditions bar petrification. The puffballs automatically fail all saving throws.

The puffballs erupt if they take any damage or a creature moves into their space, immediately destroying a 5-foot square. Each creature within 5 feet of the puffballs when they erupt must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking [[/r 3d6]] necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

Sorcery Points.name: 术法点
Sorcery Points.description:
Sorcery Points. The sporeslinger has 3 sorcery points. It regains all its spent sorcery points when it finishes a long rest. It can spend its sorcery points on the following options:

Quickened Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, it can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Twinned Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn’t have a range of self, it can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell’s level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

Sporestaff.name: Sporestaff
Sporestaff.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) bludgeoning damage. Hit or miss, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the sporeslinger and its hyphan allies until the end of the sporeslinger’s next turn.

Smokescreen.name: Smokescreen
Smokescreen.description: The sporeslinger shakes its staff, creating a 5-foot-diameter sphere of black smoke centred on it that heavily obscures the area. It then moves up to its speed.

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The sporeslinger is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

Cantrips (at will): @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.vrN18tbTw7io5MWd]{Chill Touch}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.Utk1OQRwYkMkFRD3]{Mage Hand}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.kjmjY0zlE6IEiQVL]{Mending}, @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.g2u9PYfqWQAyg9OI]{Poison Spray}

1st level (4 slots): @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.eS7XnnApoxRxYXPs]{Charm Person}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.spells-heliana-the-veiled-lady.CEOqe98njsk9Hvba]{Corrupting Ichor}, 

2nd level (3 slots): @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.spells-heliana-the-veiled-lady.8uXEnEvpv5ECUVbO]{Mortiferous Pulse}

The sporelinger is a spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma.

Chill Touch.name: 颤栗之触
Chill Touch.description:
You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.

If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Mending.name: 修复术
Mending.description:
该法术修复你所触碰一个物件上的一处破损或裂缝，例如修复一条断裂的链条、一把碎成两半的钥匙、一件撕裂的斗篷、一个漏了的酒袋等。只要破损或断裂处在任意方向上都不超过 1 尺，你就可以不留痕迹地修复它。

该法术可以物理性地修复一件魔法物品，但无法恢复其上的魔法。

Poison Spray.name: 毒气喷溅
Poison Spray.description:
你伸手向施法距离内一个你能看见的生物喷出一阵毒气。目标必须进行一次体质豁免，豁免失败则受 1d12 毒素伤害。

你到达 5 级时，该法术的伤害增加 1d12（变为 2d12）。11 级时再加 1d12（变为 3d12），17 级时再加 1d12（变为 4d12）。

Corrupting Ichor.name: Corrupting Ichor
Corrupting Ichor.description:
Corrupting Ichor

1st-level necromancy

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: 60 feet

Components: S, M (some phlegm)

Duration: Instantaneous

Mechanism: Damage; RSA

Classes: Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

You spit a globule of phlegm at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 necrotic damage immediately and 1d8 necrotic damage at the end of its next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage at the end of the target’s next turn increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attack.chatFlavor: You spit a globule of phlegm at one creature within range.

Charm Person.name: 魅惑类人
Charm Person.description:
你尝试魅惑施法距离内的某个你能看见的类人生物。该生物必须进行一次感知豁免。如果你或你的同伴正在和该生物战斗，则该生物进行该豁免时具有优势。如果豁免失败，则该生物被你魅惑至法术终止，或者直到你或你的同伴对他做出伤害行为为止。此间，被魅惑的生物将视你为友方且熟悉的人。法术终止后，该生物将会发觉曾被你魅惑过。

升环施法：使用二环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术就能多影响一个目标。而各目标之间距离不能超过 30 尺。

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: 一道看不见的力场制护盾浮现在你身旁，保护着你。在你的下一回合开始前，你的 AC 具有 +5 加值（在触发该法术的攻击之前生效），并且不会受到魔法飞弹的伤害。

activation.condition: 当你被攻击命中或被作为魔法飞弹的目标时执行

Mortiferous Pulse.name: Mortiferous Pulse
Mortiferous Pulse.description:
Mortiferous Pulse

2nd-level biomancy* (*can be replaced with necromancy)

Casting Time: 1 action

Range: Self (50-foot line)

Components: V, S, M (a dead animal)

Duration: Instantaneous

Mechanism: Damage; Dex save

Classes: Bard, Druid, Warlock

You summon a bolt of negative energy to stimulate and transmit necrotic pathogens into those that stand before you, decaying their internal viscera. Each creature in a line 50 feet long and 5 feet wide extending from you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Fungal Infection.name: Fungal Infection
Fungal Infection.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock, Wizard

With an exhalation, fungal spores waft their way towards a point within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centred on that point must succeed on a [[/save con format=long]] or become cursed until the spell ends.

When you cast the spell, choose one of the following fungi to grow on the cursed creatures:

  • Amanita Rotgut. The creature immediately takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage and becomes &reference[poisoned]. While poisoned in this way, the creature takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage at the end of each of its subsequent turns.
  • Necrotising Zygomycosis. The creature immediately takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage, and takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage at the start of each of its turns.
  • Psilocybin Quickitrippiae. The creature begins ‘tripping’. It must roll a [[/r d4]] at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature doesn’t move or take actions this turn.
  • Paralysing Mucorales. At the end of each of the creature’s turns, it becomes &reference[stunned] until the start of its next turn. If the creature fails a saving throw against this spell by 5 or more then, if it would be &reference[stunned], it is &reference[paralyzed] instead.
  • Raging Henbane. The creature becomes &reference[charmed] by you and must use its reaction at the start of each of its turns to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach/range other than you.
  • Veiled Lady. The creature’s vision darkens to a pinhole; the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks have advantage against the creature.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns (after the effects of this spell have triggered), ending the effect on itself on a success.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) of Amanita Rotgut and Necrotising Zygomycosis increases by [[/damage 1d6]] and [[/damage 1d8]], respectively, for each slot level above 4th. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can choose two different fungi to grow on affected targets instead of one.

Spike Storm.description: The duskcap fires a torrent of spikes in either a 20-foot cone or in a 10-foot sphere. Each other creature in the area must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success.

Grounded.name: Grounded
Grounded.description: The brute has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to prevent it being moved against its will.

Reckless.name: 鲁莽
Reckless.description: At the start of its turn, the brute can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

Sun Sickness.name: 厌日症
Sun Sickness.description: While in sunlight, or if it takes 5 or more radiant damage in a single turn, the hyphan has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. The brute dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

Broken Sword.name: Broken Sword
Broken Sword.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 ([[/r 2d4 + 3]]) slashing damage.

Smush.name: Smush
Smush.description: The brute moves up to 5 feet and can occupy the space of a creature 1 or more sizes smaller than it. A creature whose space it enters must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 6 ([[/r 1d12]]) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and pushes the brute back to the space from which it moved. While the brute occupies the space of a creature it knocked prone in this way, the creature is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, it is restrained.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them, with the brute choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The fungal guardians regain spent legendary actions at the start of the turn of the guardian with the highest initiative.

The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them.

Rampage.name: 横行
Rampage.description: The brute moves up to its speed and can move through the spaces of creature 1 or more sizes smaller than it. Each creature whose space it moves through must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw, taking 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success. A creature can be affected by this action no more than once per turn.

SS23hKolETs3nesb.name: Decrepit Hyphan Sporeslinger
SS23hKolETs3nesb.description:
Innately magical creatures that get ‘hyphanated’ (the term used by scholars to describe the act by which a creature is overcome by a hyphan colony) will become sporeslingers. Some of these individuals may remember the spells they knew in life, but, for the most part, this connection with the Weave is co-opted to provide the colony access to charm-based magics. Sporeslingers use these beguiling enchantments to capture stray creatures and deliver them to the fungal heart where they too can be hyphanated. Without these specimens, a hive mind would have to rely on serendipity to gather new biomass. With them, it can take a more proactive approach.

Self-preservation. A hyphan hive mind is far from stupid. It understands the fragility and value of a sporeslinger. A sporeslinger possesses the ability to produce clouds of obscuring spores (from which to make its escape) and is rarely found alone. On diplomatic missions they may be accompanied by brutes, for their intimidating size. When laying a trap, a sporeslinger may stand alone in a field of barely-visible puffball toadstools, several duskcaps lying in wait in the shadows.

Sorcery Points.name: 术法点
Sorcery Points.description:
Sorcery Points. The sporeslinger has 3 sorcery points. It regains all its spent sorcery points when it finishes a long rest. It can spend its sorcery points on the following options:

Quickened Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, it can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Twinned Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn’t have a range of self, it can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell’s level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

Sporestaff.name: Sporestaff
Sporestaff.description: [[/attack format=extended]]. [[/damage format=extended]]. Hit or miss, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save format=extended]] or be &Reference[Charmed] by the sporeslinger and its hyphan allies until the end of the sporeslinger’s next turn.

Sporestaff.name: Sporestaff
Sporestaff.description: This creature is &Reference[Charmed] by the sporeslinger and its hyphan allies until the end of the sporeslinger's next turn.

Smokescreen.name: Smokescreen
Smokescreen.description: The sporeslinger shakes its staff, creating a 5-foot-diameter sphere of black smoke centred on it that heavily obscures the area. It then moves up to its speed.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them, with the brute choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The fungal guardians regain spent legendary actions at the start of the turn of the guardian with the highest initiative.

The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them.

Rage Spores.name: Rage Spores
Rage Spores.description: The sporeslinger blows a plume of spores in a 20-foot cone. Each non-hyphan creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or immediately use its reaction to make a weapon attack against a randomly determined, non-hyphan creature within its reach/range.

Sun Sickness.name: 厌日症
Sun Sickness.description: While in sunlight, or if it takes 5 or more radiant damage in a single turn, the hyphan has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. The brute dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

Metamagic: Twinned Spell.name: Metamagic: Twinned Spell
Metamagic: Twinned Spell.description: Twinned Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn’t have a range of self, it can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell’s level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

Metamagic: Quickened Spell.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
Metamagic: Quickened Spell.description: Quickened Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, it can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The sporeslinger is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]], +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

At will: @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.2JBKHgnzqf3SyEH8]{chill touch}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.jWPzZZ6AAoTKwl8C]{mage hand}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.qOYIhN90X5jVwrtf]{mending}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.pRNIGGIXJiSSNyYo]{poison spray}

2/day each: @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.73InkQGCPSiYd4qU]{charm person}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.smd1gkvcU3bcMX4g]{corrupting ichor}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.UvreoqdJ7qtPufsa]{mortiferous pulse}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.SS23hKolETs3nesb.Item.DqxFewzsRstKnhXE]{shield}

The sporelinger is a spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma.

Chill Touch.name: 颤栗之触
Chill Touch.description:
You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.

If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Mending.name: 修复术
Mending.description:
该法术修复你所触碰一个物件上的一处破损或裂缝，例如修复一条断裂的链条、一把碎成两半的钥匙、一件撕裂的斗篷、一个漏了的酒袋等。只要破损或断裂处在任意方向上都不超过 1 尺，你就可以不留痕迹地修复它。

该法术可以物理性地修复一件魔法物品，但无法恢复其上的魔法。

Poison Spray.name: 毒气喷溅
Poison Spray.description:
你伸手向施法距离内一个你能看见的生物喷出一阵毒气。目标必须进行一次体质豁免，豁免失败则受 1d12 毒素伤害。

你到达 5 级时，该法术的伤害增加 1d12（变为 2d12）。11 级时再加 1d12（变为 3d12），17 级时再加 1d12（变为 4d12）。

Charm Person.name: 魅惑类人
Charm Person.description:
你尝试魅惑施法距离内的某个你能看见的类人生物。该生物必须进行一次感知豁免。如果你或你的同伴正在和该生物战斗，则该生物进行该豁免时具有优势。如果豁免失败，则该生物被你魅惑至法术终止，或者直到你或你的同伴对他做出伤害行为为止。此间，被魅惑的生物将视你为友方且熟悉的人。法术终止后，该生物将会发觉曾被你魅惑过。

升环施法：使用二环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术就能多影响一个目标。而各目标之间距离不能超过 30 尺。

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: 一道看不见的力场制护盾浮现在你身旁，保护着你。在你的下一回合开始前，你的 AC 具有 +5 加值（在触发该法术的攻击之前生效），并且不会受到魔法飞弹的伤害。

activation.condition: 当你被攻击命中或被作为魔法飞弹的目标时执行

Mortiferous Pulse.name: Mortiferous Pulse
Mortiferous Pulse.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock

You summon a bolt of negative energy to stimulate and transmit necrotic pathogens into those that stand before you, decaying their internal viscera. Each creature in a 5-foot-wide, 50-foot-long line extending from you must make a [[/save dex format=long]], taking [[/damage]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

Corrupting Ichor.name: Corrupting Ichor
Corrupting Ichor.description:
Class: Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

You spit a globule of phlegm at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage]] damage. In addition, until it uses its action to wipe off the phlegm, it takes [[/r 1d4]] necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns and any hit points regained are reduced by half.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage at the start of the target’s next turn increases by [[/r 1d4]] for each slot level above 1st.

Corrupting Ichor phlegm.name: Corrupting Ichor phlegm
Corrupting Ichor phlegm.description:
In addition, until it uses its action to wipe off the phlegm, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns and any hit points regained are reduced by half.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage at the start of the target’s next turn increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

Infectious Spores.name: Infectious Spores
Infectious Spores.description: The heart chooses one creature within the lair. A variety of small mushrooms grow around it, releasing their spores and casting the  spell @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.cIWJunlaFvcCbpPQ]{Fungal Infection} on it (no concentration required; [[/save 12 con format=long]]).

Fungal Infection.name: Fungal Infection
Fungal Infection.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock, Wizard

With an exhalation, fungal spores waft their way towards a point within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centred on that point must succeed on a [[/save con format=long]] or become cursed until the spell ends.

When you cast the spell, choose one of the following fungi to grow on the cursed creatures:

  • Amanita Rotgut. The creature immediately takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage and becomes &reference[poisoned]. While poisoned in this way, the creature takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage at the end of each of its subsequent turns.
  • Necrotising Zygomycosis. The creature immediately takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage, and takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage at the start of each of its turns.
  • Psilocybin Quickitrippiae. The creature begins ‘tripping’. It must roll a [[/r d4]] at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature doesn’t move or take actions this turn.
  • Paralysing Mucorales. At the end of each of the creature’s turns, it becomes &reference[stunned] until the start of its next turn. If the creature fails a saving throw against this spell by 5 or more then, if it would be &reference[stunned], it is &reference[paralyzed] instead.
  • Raging Henbane. The creature becomes &reference[charmed] by you and must use its reaction at the start of each of its turns to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach/range other than you.
  • Veiled Lady. The creature’s vision darkens to a pinhole; the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks have advantage against the creature.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns (after the effects of this spell have triggered), ending the effect on itself on a success.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) of Amanita Rotgut and Necrotising Zygomycosis increases by [[/damage 1d6]] and [[/damage 1d8]], respectively, for each slot level above 4th. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can choose two different fungi to grow on affected targets instead of one.

Amanita Rotgut.name: Amanita Rotgut
Amanita Rotgut.description: This creature is &Reference[Poisoned] and takes [[/damage 2d6 poison]] damage at the end of each of its turns. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns after it has taken the poison damage, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Necrotising Zygomycosis.name: Necrotising Zygomycosis
Necrotising Zygomycosis.description: This creature takes [[/damage 2d8 necrotic]] damage at the start of each of its turns. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Psilocybin Quickitrippiae.name: Psilocybin Quickitrippiae
Psilocybin Quickitrippiae.description: The creature begins ‘tripping’. It must roll a [[/r d4]] at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature doesn’t move or take actions this turn. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Paralysing Mucorales.name: Paralysing Mucorales
Paralysing Mucorales.description: At the end of each of the creature’s turns, it becomes &reference[stunned] until the start of its next turn. If the creature fails a saving throw against this spell by 5 or more then, if it would be &reference[stunned], it is &reference[paralyzed] instead. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Raging Henbane.name: Raging Henbane
Raging Henbane.description: The creature becomes &reference[charmed] by you and must use its reaction at the start of each of its turns to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach/range other than you. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Veiled Lady.name: Veiled Lady
Veiled Lady.description: The creature’s vision darkens to a pinhole; the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks have advantage against the creature. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Mindfunk Spores.name: Mindfunk Spores
Mindfunk Spores.description: The heart chooses one creature within the lair, shooting a spray of spore-containing acid at it from a nearby toadstool. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage average]] damage and must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM]{Dominate Person} spell until the end of its next turn. The heart can’t use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

Sprout Puffballs.name: Sprout Puffballs
Sprout Puffballs.description:
Grey-black puffballs sprout in a 10-foot square originating from a point on a surface within the lair. Each 5-foot square area of puffballs has AC 5, 1 hit point, immunity to necrotic damage, and immunity to all conditions bar petrification. The puffballs automatically fail all saving throws.

The puffballs erupt if they take any damage or a creature moves into their space, immediately destroying a 5-foot square. Each creature within 5 feet of the puffballs when they erupt must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

Lesser Veiled Lady.name: Lesser Veiled Lady
Lesser Veiled Lady.description:
Hyphan colonies have an entirely alien system of ethics compared to other races of The Low. They have no concept of ‘murder’ or ‘theft’; everything is simply ‘useful’ or ‘waste’. This simplified outlook on life often brings hyphan colonies into conflict with other races.

Some colonies employ a plan of rapid relocation, moving themselves to new locations as soon as their existence is discovered. Others act hyper-aggresively, consuming any creature the moment it steps within their borders. Some colonies, in particular those that are in close proximity to other races, have developed a humanoid-like persona to interact with those peoples: a veiled lady.

The landscape of hyphan foreign policy is constantly changing as strategies that result in extermination fail to propogate, and colonies develop new, unique schemes.

Appearance. In the dim light of an underground cavern, a veiled lady appears as a huge, gowned silhouette, faintly feminine in shape. Closer inspection reveals a hollow where one might expect a cranium, and skin formed of constantly shifting threads of ultra-fine mycelia. A veiled lady appears to drift across the floor, gliding up unclimbable walls and squeezing through minute gaps without apparent effort.

Sun Sickness.name: 厌日症
Sun Sickness.description: While in sunlight, or if it takes 5 or more radiant damage in a single turn, the hyphan has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. The brute dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

Hyphal Tether.name: Hyphal Tether
Hyphal Tether.description: Tendrils of grasping hyphae burst from the ground, grabbing at one creature the Veiled Lady can see within 30 feet of the it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or become &Reference[grappled] (escape DC [[lookup @abilities.dex.dc]]). Until this grapple ends, a creature is restrained

save.chatFlavor: On failure: grappled. While grappled in this way: restrained.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The Veiled Lady can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Veiled Lady regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

The Veiled Lady can take 3 legendary actions.

Mycelial Reconstitution.name: Mycelial Reconstitution
Mycelial Reconstitution.description: Mycelial Reconstitution.  The Veiled Lady dissolves into mycelia, ending any grapples or restraining effects to which it is currently subjected, and reappears in an unoccupied space on the ground it can see within 30 feet of it. This does not end grapples created by the Veiled Lady’s Hyphal Tether.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The Veiled Lady uses either its Infectious Spores or Shackles of Pain, then makes two halluciwhip attacks.

Halluciwhip.name: Halluciwhip
Halluciwhip.description: [[/attack format=extended]]. [[/damage format=extended]] and the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned] until the end of its next turn.

attack.chatFlavor: On failure: creature poisoned until end of its next turn.

save.chatFlavor: On failure: creature poisoned until end of its next turn.

Infectious Spores (Recharge 5-6).name: Infectious Spores (Recharge 5-6)
Infectious Spores (Recharge 5-6).description: The Veiled Lady exhales a cloud of spores at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save con dc=@abilities.con.dc format=long]] or become afflicted as per the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.cIWJunlaFvcCbpPQ]{Fungal Infection} spell for the next minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Shackles of Pain (Recharge 5-6).name: Shackles of Pain (Recharge 5-6)
Shackles of Pain (Recharge 5-6).description: The Veiled Lady exhales a cloud of spores at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save con dc=@abilities.con.dc format=long]] or become afflicted as per the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.oj0UVBJsE0I866Py]{Shackles of Pain} spell; each time the Veiled Lady takes damage, the afflicted creature takes psychic damage equal to half that damage and can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. The Veiled Lady can have only one creature afflicted by Shackles of Pain at a time.

Whip.name: Whip
Whip.description: Whip. The Veiled Lady makes a halluciwhip attack.

attack.chatFlavor: On failure: poisoned until end of its next turn.

save.chatFlavor: On failure: poisoned until end of its next turn.

Legendary Resistance (2/day).name: Legendary Resistance (2/day)
Legendary Resistance (2/day).description: If the Veiled Lady fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Amorphous.name: 无定形
Amorphous.description: The Veiled Lady can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Mycelia Climb.name: Mycelia Climb
Mycelia Climb.description: The Veiled Lady can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Detritivore.name: Detritivore
Detritivore.description: As a bonus action, the Veiled Lady can target one Small or larger corpse not under the effects of the gentle repose spell or one Small or larger creature that has 0 hit points and is still alive that the Veiled Lady can see within 5 feet of it. If the target is alive, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or automatically fail one death saving throw. On a failure, or if the target is a corpse, the Veiled Lady regains [[/heal average]] hit points. Once a corpse has been targeted by this feature, it becomes desiccated and can’t be targeted again.

Communication Spores.name: Communication Spores
Communication Spores.description: The Veiled Lady’s telepathy extends throughout its lair. It communicates using images and emotion.

Necrotising Zygomycosis.description: This creature takes [[/damage 2d8 necrotic]] damage at the start of each of its turns. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Psilocybin Quickitrippiae.name: Psilocybin Quickitrippiae
Psilocybin Quickitrippiae.description: The creature begins ‘tripping’. It must roll a [[/r d4]] at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature doesn’t move or take actions this turn. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Paralysing Mucorales.name: Paralysing Mucorales
Paralysing Mucorales.description: At the end of each of the creature’s turns, it becomes &reference[stunned] until the start of its next turn. If the creature fails a saving throw against this spell by 5 or more then, if it would be &reference[stunned], it is &reference[paralyzed] instead. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Raging Henbane.name: Raging Henbane
Raging Henbane.description: The creature becomes &reference[charmed] by you and must use its reaction at the start of each of its turns to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach/range other than you. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Veiled Lady.name: Veiled Lady
Veiled Lady.description: The creature’s vision darkens to a pinhole; the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks have advantage against the creature. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Shackles of Pain.name: Shackles of Pain
Shackles of Pain.description:
Class: Bard, Cleric, Paladin, Warlock

You link the vitality of a willing creature within range—the source—to the psyche of another creature within range—the target. The target must succeed on a [[/save cha format=long]] or become linked to the source for 1 minute. Each time the source takes damage, the target takes psychic damage equal to half the damage the source took. If you yourself are the source, the creature takes this damage immediately before you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration. Whenever the target takes damage in this way, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

Source of Pain.name: Source of Pain
Source of Pain.description: When this creature takes damage, the target takes half of the damage as psychic damage.

Target of Pain.name: Target of Pain
Target of Pain.description: This creature takes half of the damage the source takes as psychic damage when the source takes damage.

Vigorous Hyphan Sporeslinger.name: Vigorous Hyphan Sporeslinger
Vigorous Hyphan Sporeslinger.description:
Innately magical creatures that get ‘hyphanated’ (the term used by scholars to describe the act by which a creature is overcome by a hyphan colony) will become sporeslingers. Some of these individuals may remember the spells they knew in life, but, for the most part, this connection with the Weave is co-opted to provide the colony access to charm-based magics. Sporeslingers use these beguiling enchantments to capture stray creatures and deliver them to the fungal heart where they too can be hyphanated. Without these specimens, a hive mind would have to rely on serendipity to gather new biomass. With them, it can take a more proactive approach.

Self-preservation. A hyphan hive mind is far from stupid. It understands the fragility and value of a sporeslinger. A sporeslinger possesses the ability to produce clouds of obscuring spores (from which to make its escape) and is rarely found alone. On diplomatic missions they may be accompanied by brutes, for their intimidating size. When laying a trap, a sporeslinger may stand alone in a field of barely-visible puffball toadstools, several duskcaps lying in wait in the shadows.

Sorcery Points.name: 术法点
Sorcery Points.description:
Sorcery Points. The sporeslinger has 11 sorcery points. It regains all its spent sorcery points when it finishes a long rest. It can spend its sorcery points on the following options:

Quickened Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, it can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Twinned Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn’t have a range of self, it can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell’s level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

Smokescreen.name: Smokescreen
Smokescreen.description: The sporeslinger shakes its staff, creating a 5-foot-diameter sphere of black smoke centred on it that heavily obscures the area. It then moves up to its speed.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them, with the brute choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The fungal guardians regain spent legendary actions at the start of the turn of the guardian with the highest initiative.

The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them.

Rage Spores.name: Rage Spores
Rage Spores.description: The sporeslinger blows a plume of spores in a 20-foot cone. Each non-hyphan creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or immediately use its reaction to make a weapon attack against a randomly determined, non-hyphan creature within its reach/range.

Sun Sickness.name: 厌日症
Sun Sickness.description: While in sunlight, or if it takes 15 or more radiant damage in a single turn, the hyphan has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. The brute dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The sporeslinger is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC [[lookup @abilities.cha.dc]], +9 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

At will: @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.o3sa7jfCffnBcZ8Z]{charm person}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.eWzYcJASFlbfsS3S]{chill touch}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.1cffULNFUiqrsQpu]{mage hand}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.whNZOPb8vftOzb9z]{mending}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.ag7VIVjqefdvxltA]{mirror image}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.gZMiW4ZHhqbmBz9w]{mortiferous pulse}

3/day each: @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.STSuD2MiWc4RWCLW]{haste}c, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.ijiaRCksyOY8R5mt]{hypnotic pattern}c, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.xNM92li6CMGrLM6d]{shield}

2/day each: @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.lnCNi9rCg61pLRi3]{blight}, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.SkgdbmI7plE6mie7]{polymorph}c

1/day each: @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.Gig4Lulp9EjUecOK]{dominate person}c, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.MFYzME9devWQpUFM]{insect plague}c, @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.actors-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Actor.V7drBLrgdDR6YvLI.Item.o9I9jUVONh1OVAWG]{lungburst}

The sporelinger is a spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma.

Polymorph.name: 变形术
Polymorph.description:
该法术将一个施法距离内你能看见的生物变化为一个新的形态。一个非自愿的生物必须进行一次感知豁免来避免此效应。该法术无法对变形生物或生命值为 0 的生物生效。

法术产生的变化在法术持续时间内得以维持，或直至目标的生命值降为 0 或死亡。新形态可以是任何挑战等级小于等于目标本身的野兽（如果目标没有挑战等级，则以其等级为基准）。目标的游戏资料以及心智相关的属性值都将被所选定野兽的属性数据取代。而其阵营和个性则仍然保留。

目标使用其新形态的生命值。当它变回正常形态时，则立即恢复变化前的生命值。如果目标因为生命值降至 0 而变回正常形态，则其正常形态需要承受所有的溢出伤害。只要溢出的伤害没有将该生物正常形态的生命值降为 0，它就不会因打击而陷入昏迷。

该生物可作出的动作因其新形态而有所限制。它不能说话，不能施法，也不能作出其他需要用手和需要说话的动作。

目标的装备融入新形态中，但其不能启动，使用，挥舞或以其他方式从其装备上获得增益。

Insect Plague.name: 疫病虫群
Insect Plague.description:
你指定施法距离内一点，并以该点为中心使半径 20 尺的球状区域内堆满成群的噬人蝗虫。虫群会绕过拐角扩散并使整个区域成为困难地形，且处于轻度遮蔽。虫群在法术终止前都会持续存在。

当虫群显现时，其区域内的每个生物都必须进行一次体质豁免，豁免失败则受到 4d10 的穿刺伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。生物在一个回合内第一次进入该区域内，或者在区域内结束其回合时，也必须进行该豁免。

升环施法： 使用六环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比六环高一环，伤害就增加 1d10。

materials.value: 少许糖，一些脱壳的谷粒和一抹油脂

Dominate Person.name: 支配类人
Dominate Person.description:
你试图安抚一个施法距离内你能看见的类人生物，目标生物必须必须成功通过一次感知豁免，否则将在法术持续时间内被你魅惑。若它正与你或你的友方生物战斗，则其进行该豁免时具有优势。

目标被魅惑时，只要你与其处于同一位面就可以与之保持心灵感应。你在有意识时，可以通过心灵感应命令该生物（不需要作动作），而它则会尽量服从。你可以描述一个简单具体的行为指令，比如“攻击那个生物”“跑到那个位置”或是“去拿那个物品”。生物完成一项指令却未收到你的进一步指示时，将会使用其本身的能力尽可能的保护自己。

你可以使用动作以彻底而精确的控制目标。直至下个你的回合结束为止，该生物只能执行由你选择的一个或数个动作之一，且不能进行任何未经你许可的行动。在此期间，你还可以用自己的反应去要求该生物执行一项反应。

每次目标受到伤害时，都可以尝试进行一次感知豁免，豁免成功则法术终止。

升环施法：使用六环法术位施展该法术时，持续时间变为：专注，至多 10 分钟。使用七环法术位施展该法术时，持续时间变为：专注，至多 1 小时。使用八环或更高法术位施展该法术时，持续时间变为：专注，至多 8 小时。

Metamagic: Twinned Spell.name: Metamagic: Twinned Spell
Metamagic: Twinned Spell.description: Twinned Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn’t have a range of self, it can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell’s level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

Metamagic: Quickened Spell.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
Metamagic: Quickened Spell.description: Quickened Spell. When the sporeslinger casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, it can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

Lungburst.name: Lungburst
Lungburst.description:
Class: Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

You cause rapid and unpredictable changes in the internal air pressure of a creature you can see within range, rupturing its breathing apparatus. The creature must make a [[/save con format=long]]. A creature that is holding its breath makes this saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage thunder 7d6]] damage, [[/damage necrotic 7d6]] damage, and immediately begins suffocating. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and does not begin suffocating. A creature suffocating in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending its suffocation on a success.

A creature that does not need to breathe is immune to the effects of this spell. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{greater restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qcYitWoSMTnKkzM1]{heal}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{wish} spell can restore a creature’s ability to breathe, and end its suffocation.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the thunder and necrotic damage both increase by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 6th.

Chill Touch.name: 颤栗之触
Chill Touch.description:
You create a ghostly, skeletal hand in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 Necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the hand clings to the target.

If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.

This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Charm Person.name: 魅惑类人
Charm Person.description:
你尝试魅惑施法距离内的某个你能看见的类人生物。该生物必须进行一次感知豁免。如果你或你的同伴正在和该生物战斗，则该生物进行该豁免时具有优势。如果豁免失败，则该生物被你魅惑至法术终止，或者直到你或你的同伴对他做出伤害行为为止。此间，被魅惑的生物将视你为友方且熟悉的人。法术终止后，该生物将会发觉曾被你魅惑过。

升环施法：使用二环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，法术就能多影响一个目标。而各目标之间距离不能超过 30 尺。

Mortiferous Pulse.name: Mortiferous Pulse
Mortiferous Pulse.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock

You summon a bolt of negative energy to stimulate and transmit necrotic pathogens into those that stand before you, decaying their internal viscera. Each creature in a 5-foot-wide, 50-foot-long line extending from you must make a [[/save dex format=long]], taking [[/damage]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

Mending.name: 修复术
Mending.description:
该法术修复你所触碰一个物件上的一处破损或裂缝，例如修复一条断裂的链条、一把碎成两半的钥匙、一件撕裂的斗篷、一个漏了的酒袋等。只要破损或断裂处在任意方向上都不超过 1 尺，你就可以不留痕迹地修复它。

该法术可以物理性地修复一件魔法物品，但无法恢复其上的魔法。

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手
Mage Hand.description:
A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

Mirror Image.name: 镜影术
Mirror Image.description:
三个与你自身一模一样的幻象分身出现在你所处的空间中。直至法术终止前，所有分身都会随你移动、模仿你的动作、并不断地变换位置，使人无法追踪判断哪个是你的分身哪个是你的真身。分身存在期间，你可以用动作来消解这些幻象分身。

在法术持续时间内，每当有生物以你为目标发动攻击时，其攻击都有概率改为以三个分身之一为目标，你掷一枚[[/r 1d20 #镜像术检定]]：

如果你有三个分身，则你必须掷出 6 或更高数值才能使此次攻击的目标改为分身；如果你有两个分身，则你必须掷出 8 或更高数值；如果你有一个分身，则你必须掷出 11 或更高数值。

每个分身的 AC 都等于 10 + 你的敏捷调整值。如果一次攻击命中了分身，该分身将立即被摧毁。分身只会被命中它的攻击摧毁，其无视所有其他的伤害和效应。三个分身全部被毁后此法术提前终止。

如果一个生物无法视物、它可以依靠视觉之外的其它感官视物（例如盲视），又或者它可以看破幻象（例如真实视觉），则该生物将不受此法术影响。

Haste.name: 加速术
Haste.description:
指定施法距离内一个你能看见的自愿生物。直至法术终止前，你使目标速度翻倍；其 AC 获得 +2 加值；其进行敏捷豁免时具有优势；其每个回合都可作出一个额外的动作，但该动作只能用于执行攻击（只限一次武器攻击），或者疾行、撤离、躲藏和使用物件动作。

法术终止时，目标将泛起一阵倦意使其不能移动也无法执行动作，并持续至其下一回合结束。

Haste.name: 加速术
Haste.description: 直至法术终止前，施法者使你速度翻倍；你的 AC 获得 +2 加值；你进行敏捷豁免时具有优势；你的每一回合都可作出一个额外的动作，但该动作只能用于执行攻击（只限一次武器攻击），或者疾行、撤离、躲藏和使用物件动作。

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: 一道看不见的力场制护盾浮现在你身旁，保护着你。在你的下一回合开始前，你的 AC 具有 +5 加值（在触发该法术的攻击之前生效），并且不会受到魔法飞弹的伤害。

activation.condition: 当你被攻击命中或被作为魔法飞弹的目标时执行

Hypnotic Pattern.name: 催眠图纹
Hypnotic Pattern.description:
You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed for the duration. While charmed by this spell, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

materials.value: 一根点燃的熏香或一个装有磷光材料的水晶小瓶

Blight.name: 枯萎术
Blight.description:
死灵魔法的能量袭向一个施法距离内你能看见的生物，并榨取他的水分和活力。目标必须进行一次体质豁免，豁免失败者将受到 8d8 点暗蚀伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。本法术对构装和亡灵生物无效。

若你以一个植物或魔法植物为目标，则其豁免检定具有劣势，且法术对它的伤害取最大值。

若你以一个非魔法非生物的植物为目标，如一棵树或灌木，则它不进行豁免而直接枯萎死去。

升环施法： 使用五环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比四环高一环，法术的伤害就增加 1d8。

Sporestaff.name: Sporestaff
Sporestaff.description: [[/attack format=extended]]. [[/damage format=extended]]. Hit or miss, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save format=extended]] or be &Reference[Charmed] by the sporeslinger and its hyphan allies until the end of the sporeslinger’s next turn.

Sporestaff.name: Sporestaff
Sporestaff.description: This creature is &Reference[Charmed] by the sporeslinger and its hyphan allies until the end of the sporeslinger's next turn.

Infectious Spores.name: Infectious Spores
Infectious Spores.description: Infectious Spores. The heart chooses one creature within the lair. A variety of small mushrooms grow around it, releasing their spores and casting the  spell @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady.cIWJunlaFvcCbpPQ]{Fungal Infection} on it (no concentration required; DC 12 Constitution saving throw).

Mindfunk Spores.name: Mindfunk Spores
Mindfunk Spores.description: Mindfunk Spores. The heart chooses one creature within the lair, shooting a spray of spore-containing acid at it from a nearby toadstool. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/r 1d6]] acid damage and must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM]{Dominate Person} spell until the end of its next turn. The heart can’t use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

Sprout Puffballs.name: Sprout Puffballs
Sprout Puffballs.description:
Sprout Puffballs. Grey-black puffballs sprout in a 10-foot square originating from a point on a surface within the lair. Each 5-foot square area of puffballs has AC 5, 1 hit point, immunity to necrotic damage, and immunity to all conditions bar petrification. The puffballs automatically fail all saving throws.

The puffballs erupt if they take any damage or a creature moves into their space, immediately destroying a 5-foot square. Each creature within 5 feet of the puffballs when they erupt must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking [[/r 1d6]] necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

Swarm of Pufflings.name: Swarm of Pufflings
Swarm of Pufflings.description:
Puffling Swarm Spawner

A rapid rustling sound and the gleam of hundreds of tiny proto-eyes might be the only warning an adventurer receives as it walks through a field of swarm spawner fungi. From the depths of these morel-like mushrooms are fired a swarm of six-inch-tall, walking toadstools, whose paper-like skin trembles with contained explosive potential.

Explosive Investment. Though the actions of a swarm spawner fungus and its self-destructive pufflings might seem spiteful at the outset, its actually a carefully measured trade off. If a colony can gain more biomass than it expends to acquire that biomass, then there is a net gain, and the colony can expand. Using the aeons-spanning knowledge and experience hive minds have at their disposal, hyphan colonies have learnt to hold off from unleashing their traps until its quarry has progressed so deep within a fungal field that its chances of escape are nil.

Swarm.name: 集群
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny mushroom. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the swarm remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary patch of fungus.

Sporeburst.name: Sporeburst
Sporeburst.description: When the swarm takes bludgeoning, force, piercing, slashing, or thunder damage, it releases puffs of necrotic spores. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Detonate.name: 爆炸
Detonate.description: The swarm takes 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) necrotic damage than can’t be reduced in any way and release a plume of spores. Each creature within 5 feet of it must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ([[/r 2d8]]) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

aKbH3JvX7If5yMKJ.name: Hyphan Brute
aKbH3JvX7If5yMKJ.description: Strong and burly creatures will be formed into brutes. Used for clearing rockfalls and to intimidate interlopers in a hyphan’s domain, these large specimens’ size can often act as an impediment in the tight tunnels of The Low. On the battlefield, brutes act as juggernauts, sending ranks of foes to the floor—perfect targets for their smaller cousins, the duskcaps. Their bulk and toughness allow them to fight without any sense of self preservation as they rampage through the enemy lines.

Grounded.name: Grounded
Grounded.description: The brute has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to prevent it being moved against its will.

Reckless.name: 鲁莽
Reckless.description: At the start of its turn, the brute can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

Sun Sickness.name: 厌日症
Sun Sickness.description: While in sunlight, or if it takes 10 or more radiant damage in a single turn, the hyphan has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. The brute dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

Smush.name: Smush
Smush.description: The brute moves up to 5 feet and can occupy the space of a creature 1 or more sizes smaller than it. A creature whose space it enters must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failure, the creature takes [[/damage average]] damage and is knocked &Reference[prone]. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and pushes the brute back to the space from which it moved. While the brute occupies the space of a creature it knocked prone in this way, the creature is &Reference[grappled] (escape DC [[lookup @abilities.str.dc]]). Until this grapple ends, it is &Reference[restrained].

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them, with the brute choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The fungal guardians regain spent legendary actions at the start of the turn of the guardian with the highest initiative.

The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them.

Rampage.name: 横行
Rampage.description: The brute moves up to its speed and can move through the spaces of creature 1 or more sizes smaller than it. Each creature whose space it moves through must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage and being knocked prone on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked &Reference[prone] on a success. A creature can be affected by this action no more than once per turn.

Sun Sickness.description: While in sunlight, or if it takes 15 or more radiant damage in a single turn, the hyphan has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn. The brute dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

On a failure, the creature takes 18 ([[/r 3d12]]) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and pushes the brute back to the space from which it moved. While the brute occupies the space of a creature it knocked prone in this way, the creature is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, it is restrained.

Legendary Actions.description:

Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The fungal guardians regain spent legendary actions at the start of the turn of the guardian with the highest initiative.

The fungal guardians (brute, duskcap, and sporeslinger) can take 3 legendary actions between them.
